hero.title: Dr. Ayten Abdullayeva
hero.description: Guarding women's health: Early diagnosis of oncological diseases, treatment of cervical pathologies, and modern laparoscopic surgery.

services.subtitle: My Services
services.title: Professional Approach to Women's Health
services.description: Early diagnosis saves lives. I offer services based on modern medical protocols for the solution of your oncological and gynecological problems.

cancerScreening.title: Oncological Screening
cancerScreening.description: Expert examination for timely detection of precancerous conditions and early-stage tumors.

surgicalOncology.title: Surgical Treatment
surgicalOncology.description: Removal of malignant tumors of the reproductive system using the most modern laparoscopic and open surgical methods.

cervicalHealth.title: Cervical Health
cervicalHealth.description: Complex diagnosis and treatment of cervical pathologies, dysplasias, and cancer.

ovarianAndUterineCare.title: Ovarian and Uterine Diseases
ovarianAndUterineCare.description: Management of ovarian cysts, uterine fibroids, and endometrial oncological risks.

chemoFollowUp.title: Post-Op and Chemotherapy Supervision
chemoFollowUp.description: Dynamic observation of patients undergoing treatment and minimizing side effects.

hormonalSupport.title: Hormonal and Supportive Therapy
hormonalSupport.description: Maintenance of hormonal balance during oncological treatments and monitoring of medication provision.

feedback.subtitle: Patient Reviews
feedback.title: Why Do They Trust Dr. Ayten Abdullayeva?

testimonials.name: Dilshad Abbasova
testimonials.text: "Thanks to Dr. Ayten, cervical cancer was detected at an early stage. Without her professionalism and moral support, it would have been very difficult to go through this path. I feel very well now."

testimonials.name: Gunel Aliyeva
testimonials.text: "I applied for laparoscopic surgery. I recovered in a very short time. The doctor's patient explanation of every detail creates great confidence in the patient."

testimonials.name: Nargiz Hasanova
testimonials.text: "Since I am in the oncological risk group, I am regularly under the supervision of Dr. Ayten. I am fully confident thanks to her modern diagnostic methods and attention."

about.subtitle: About Me
about.title: Serving Women's Health with Experience and Scientific Approach
about.description: I, Dr. Ayten Abdullayeva, have been engaged in both scientific and practical activities in the field of onco-gynecology for many years.
paragraphs: My mission is to ensure early diagnosis of oncological diseases in women and restore their health with the most modern surgical methods. As a PhD in Medicine, I am guided by international protocols in the treatment process.
An individual approach to each patient, confidentiality, and a high level of care form the basis of my treatment principle.
I regularly participate in international conferences and apply the latest innovations in the field of oncology in my practice.

faq.subtitle: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.title: About Onco-Gynecological Examination
faq.description: Answers to the most frequently asked questions about the examination process, analyses, and surgeries.

questions.question: How long does oncological screening take?
answer: Initial screening (examination, colposcopy, and smear collection) usually takes 20-30 minutes.
Results of analyses are ready within 3-5 business days depending on the laboratory.

questions.question: Is examination with insurance possible?
answer: Yes, oncological examinations and surgeries are possible through the private insurance companies we cooperate with. Please present your insurance card.

questions.question: How should I prepare for a Pap-Smear test?
answer: The test should be done after the menstrual cycle has ended (on days without bleeding). It is necessary to avoid sexual intercourse and the use of any vaginal suppositories/preparations 48 hours before the test.

questions.question: What is the recovery period after laparoscopic surgery?
answer: The advantage of laparoscopic (closed) surgery is fast recovery. The patient is usually discharged after 1 day and returns to normal life within 7-10 days.
